meanings.definition: To carry out or complete (an action or process)
meanings.sent1: She decided to unabort her plan and finish the project.
meanings.sent2: The team will unabort the construction of the new building next week.
meanings.sent3: After the rain delay, they were able to unabort the soccer game.
meanings.sent4: His determination to unabort the mission was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The chef's goal was to unabort the recipe perfectly.

meanings.definition: To bring into existence or make happen
meanings.sent1: The scientist's experiment successfully unabort a new discovery.
meanings.sent2: The artist's vision was to unabort a masterpiece on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to unabort a rabbit out of thin air.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness unabort a wave of positivity in the community.
meanings.sent5: The entrepreneur's idea could unabort a revolution in the industry.

meanings.definition: To continue or proceed with something that was previously stopped or interrupted
meanings.sent1: They had to unabort the meeting after the power outage.
meanings.sent2: The band decided to unabort their concert after the technical difficulties.
meanings.sent3: The student was relieved to unabort the exam after the fire alarm.
meanings.sent4: The team captain's speech inspired them to unabort their winning streak.
meanings.sent5: The hiker's determination helped him unabort the trek despite the storm.
